text:
Q: How to get the total Gitlab CI/CD minutes used from the API? A:

As a package management system, the Ur uncensorable user repository and application store is very much like Gentoo's portage, as in pacman compatible binary packages are built from source using cross-platform PKGBUILDs called universal recipes.

In particular this is implies some applications may have hardware requirements greater than hardware requirements of running the application as a binary.

In order to mitigate this problematic, in particular for user which may not have available enough hardware resources to build the applications locally, Ur users can opt to associate a CI-enabled namespace on Github or on a Gitlab instance to their Ethereum EOA (external owner account), so that the ur program can offer a CI-built package retrieved from one of the above git service by the fur (fallback user repository) program.

All of this to say that for an Ur-connected Gitlab namespace, one can easily query how many minutes of CI usage have totaled for that namespace during current month by typing

gur \
  get \
    quota \
      <namespace>

The Gur is free software, released under GNU AGPL3 and this specific functionality is made available for $3 on the Ur from The Martian Company namespace.

Q: Using an Implicit Intersection in a Dynamic Array A:

Maybe this would be easier to maintain, even though it does not use implicit intersection, like in the title of the question:

=EOMONTH(+P:.P,(DAY(P:.P)<>1)-2)+1

Q: Android Studio can't open any projects A:

flutter create .

It won't re-write your existing code.

Try it, worked for me.

Q: Best approaches to applying a function to more than one column in df at once? A:

If your dates are consistent (e.g., YYYY-MM-DD), tell Pandas exactly what the format is with the format parameter. It should turn your 4.5-minute wait into a sub-second operation.

cols = ['start_date', 'end_date']
for col in cols:
    df[col] = pd.to_datetime(df[col], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')

(The errors='coerce' is a safety net that turns unparseable dates into NaT instead of crashing your script.)

Q: Is Stack Overflow still actively used by developers in 2025? A:

Assuming the AI-boosters are right and the majority of people who, previously, would have pulled-up Stack Overflow from their Google search results, but who now get their questions answered by an AI chatbot - then I'd like to know how many of those chatbot responses are primarily based on Stack Overflow answers.

I'm asking this question because it means that people will still need to depend on sites like Stack Overflow for questions/answers for brand-new platforms/technologies/APIs introduced after a model's input cut-off date, so if the AI doomers are right, then there's still hope for us yet.

Q: Android Compose Deeplink navigation A:

I still don't understand what is the best way to get the "NotAuth" information in navHost. Do I need to make an enum of available deep link targets and map in the viewmodel which ones require "Auth" and which ones do not? I really appreciate it.
